Subject: LOCATION UPDATED-Bhargav Krishna, Internal Candidate Interview - 913312 - SWE II - July 13, 2015, July 15, 2015, and July 16, 2015 (##5832419##)

Body.Content:
Accept this meeting request by selecting the option: “Send the Response Now” to accurately record your acceptance. Otherwise, your scheduler will need to follow up via email to reconfirm.

** This is a public meeting request sent from an unmonitored mailbox on behalf of Monet Dailey-Hoxter**

Stephen Oliver has identified you as a participant in this interview loop.

Required Actions:

  1. Respond to this meeting request.
  2. You must select send a response; otherwise your response will not be recorded.
  3. In your response, specify if you need a conference room.

The following is included in this email:

  1. Resume & Feedback Link
  2. Job Description, Schedule & Next Steps
  3. Effective Interviews & Selling Microsoft to Candidates
  4. Interviewing Tools and Messaging Links
  5. Skype for Business Information

  1. Resume & Feedback Link:

    Resume: Krishna, Bhargav.pdf
    Feedback Link: Bhargav Krishna
  2. Job Description, Schedule & Next Steps
    1. To view the most up-to-date schedule, job description , or review any special interview instructions from the recruiter or hiring manager visit the Interview Feedback site link above (the job description is accessed by selecting the Requisition Number link)
    2. A final email confirmation will be sent by 12pm on the business day prior to the interview day and will include the final schedule.
    3. Immediately following your interview, please visit the Interview Feedback Site to submit your individual Hire/No Hire decision and specific interview feedback.
  3. Effective Interviews & Selling Microsoft to Candidates
    As an interviewer, it's important to remember that you represent Microsoft in the eyes of candidates. More than anything, it is the people and conversations they’ll remember most about this experience, including the style and focus of their discussion with you. As you engage in these conversations please keep in mind the diversity of communication and personal styles that may be different from yours, and consider that we will need the talents of diverse populations to yield superior results. It's incredibly important that we interact with every candidate with this in mind, whether s/he is a hire or no hire, so each comes away with a positive impression and can spread the word about Microsoft being a great place to work.

    Also don’t forget that strong candidates are probably considering multiple opportunities from other companies. Do not miss the chance to remind candidates of the many reasons to work at Microsoft and ensure they have a truly great experience with us!
  4. Interviewing Tools and Messaging Links:
  • Interviewing Tools and Messaging: Improve your candidate assessment capability by using the Microsoft Competency Based Interview Questions Guide
  • Use materials and websites to describe what makes MS unique: Candidate Ready Messaging – Why work here?
  • Use the following guidelines before Making a Hiring Recommendation
  • Review our mission and Microsoft Company Values

5. Skype for Business Information

.........................................................................................................................................

à Join Skype Meeting

This is an online meeting for Skype for Business, the professional meetings and communications app formerly known as Lync.

Join by phone

+14257063500 (USA - Redmond Campus) English (United States)

+18883203585 (USA - Redmond Campus) English (United States)

Find a local number

Conference ID: 782457244

Forgot your dial-in PIN? |Help 1033])!]

.........................................................................................................................................

Please note that when not calling in from the corporate network (your PC or UC phone), your PIN is required. PIN numbers must be created by Microsoft employees. Please set up your PIN in advance.

You will be the leader, please initiate the call using your PIN if prompted:

a. Enter Conference ID number, your extension, then your PIN. –or-

b. Enter Conference ID number, your phone number with a 1 before the number, then your PIN

Thank you,

Monet Dailey-Hoxter

Interview Scheduler

Microsoft Staffing

Subject: FW: Office 16 Bug Bash!

Body.Content:
As promised in this week’s Pulse, here is the invite information for the Bug Bash on July 15th – next Wednesday!

Hope to see you there if you are in Redmond, join via Skype if you are in other locations.

 

-----Original Appointment-----
From: Wendy Stidmon (Allegis Group Services Inc)
Sent: Thursday, July 9, 2015 10:45 AM
To: Wendy Stidmon (Allegis Group Services Inc); Beth Petry; Anita Oakley; Beth Petry Direct Reports (Vendor Team); Brian Lewis; Denise Carlevato (CompuCom Systems Inc); Timothy Rauenbusch
Cc: Renee Kutch (Projectline Services); Tom Pollock (Allegis Group Services Inc); Wynne Blue (Insight Global)
Subject: Office 16 Bug Bash!
When: Wednesday, July 15, 2015 10:00 AM-1:00 PM (UTC-08:00) Pacific Time (US & Canada).
Where: 36 / Shilshole

 

**DO not forward to customers. The Skype meeting is for MS staff only**

 

 

Office 16 Bug Bash

Click here to Join the Skype Call

 

What: The first ever external Office 16 bug Bash!

 

Why: This is your last chance to ensure your feature experience is what you want customers to see.

 

Who in MS: RDX, all feature PMs and Devs, Ship Drivers, release management | Anyone connected to shipping a great Office 16!

 

Who Externally: All our ~100K Office Technical Preview business and consumer participants.

 

Time: 10:00 – 1:00 pm

Where: 36 / Shilshole

THINGS TO KNOW:

v  Delicious snacks and lunch will be provided

v  Lots of opportunities to win some cool Office SWAG!

v  Your manager will be there

 

FAQ

 

Q: Do I really need to participate – will I make a difference?

A: Yes! This is our last chance to polish the product that will be used by millions of customers in the coming months.

 

Q: How do I participate if I’m in Redmond?

A: Bring your laptops to Shilshole, claim your space, and go to the designated Yammer Group for the bash and start triaging bugs in your area.

https://www.yammer.com/itpronetwork/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=6031612

 

Q: How do I participate if I’m not in Redmond?

A: Join the Skype meeting here and go to the designated Yammer Group for the bash and start triaging bugs in your area.

https://www.yammer.com/itpronetwork/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=6031612

 

Q: Are we accepting Android, Universal, Mac, or phone issues during this event?

A: No, this event is focused strictly on the desktop bits.

 

Q: How do I decide if a customer should win some SWAG?

A: This is up to you, but should be based on severity and impact. However, at this stage any bug you choose to open and/or fix for 16 should be a winner. Please see Beth Petry or Wendy Stidmon for any questions during the event OR to confirm a winner so we can get them on the follow-up list.

 

Q: Is this event under NDA?

A: No. It is open to anyone running the preview bits however we are advertising mainly to our current program customers.

 

Q: Will there be an audio component such as Skype?

A: Yes and no. There will be a Skype event for MS staff only to ensure smooth communication with product teams not located in Redmond. There will be no audio for customers.
